t: Matthew 21
The Triumphal Entry
Now*p when they drew near Jerusalem, and came to Bethphage, at the Mount of Olives, then Jesus sent two disciples,

saying to them, “Go*r into*r the*r village*r opposite*r you,*r and*r immediately*r you*r will*r find*r a*r donkey*r tied,*r and*r a*r colt*r with*r her.*r Loose*r them*ir and*r bring*r them*ir to*r Me.*r
And*r if*r anyone*r says*r anything*r to*r you,*r you*r shall*r say,*r ‘The*r Lord*r has*r need*r of*r them,’*r and*r immediately*r he*r will*r send*r them.”*r
All*p this was done that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the prophet, saying:
“Tell*pn the daughter of Zion, ‘Behold,*ld your King is coming to you, Lowly,*ld and sitting on a donkey, A*ld colt, the foal of a donkey.’”
So*p the disciples went and did as Jesus commanded them.
They brought the donkey and the colt, laid their clothes on them, and set Him*i on them.
And a very great multitude spread their clothes on the road; others cut down branches from the trees and spread them*i on the road.
Then the multitudes who went before and those who followed cried out, saying: “Hosanna*pn to the Son of David! ‘Blessed*ld is*i He who comes in the name of the Lord!’*sb Hosanna*ld in the highest!”
And*p when He had come into Jerusalem, all the city was moved, saying, “Who is this?”
So*p the multitudes said, “This is Jesus, the prophet from Nazareth of Galilee.”
Jesus Cleanses the Temple
Then*p Jesus went into the temple of God and drove out all those who bought and sold in the temple, and overturned the tables of the money changers and the seats of those who sold doves.
And He said to them, “It*r is*r written,*r ‘My*r house*r shall*r be*r called*r a*r house*r of*r prayer,’*r but*r you*r have*r made*r it*r a*r ‘den*r of*r thieves.’”*r
Then*p the*i blind and the*i lame came to Him in the temple, and He healed them.
But when the chief priests and scribes saw the wonderful things that He did, and the children crying out in the temple and saying, “Hosanna to the Son of David!” they were indignant

and said to Him, “Do You hear what these are saying?” And*p Jesus said to them, “Yes.*r Have*r you*r never*r read,*r ‘Out*rpn of*r the*r mouth*r of*r babes*r and*r nursing*r infants*r You*rld have*r perfected*r praise’?”*r
Then*p He left them and went out of the city to Bethany, and He lodged there.
The Fig Tree Withered
Now*p in the morning, as He returned to the city, He was hungry.
And seeing a fig tree by the road, He came to it and found nothing on it but leaves, and said to it, “Let*r no*r fruit*r grow*r on*r you*r ever*r again.”*r Immediately the fig tree withered away.
The Lesson of the Withered Fig Tree
And*p when the disciples saw it,*i they marveled, saying, “How did the fig tree wither away so soon?”

So*p Jesus answered and said to them, “Assuredly,*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r if*r you*r have*r faith*r and*r do*r not*r doubt,*r you*r will*r not*r only*r do*r what*r was*r done*r to*r the*r fig*r tree,*r but*r also*r if*r you*r say*r to*r this*r mountain,*r ‘Be*r removed*r and*r be*r cast*r into*r the*r sea,’*r it*r will*r be*r done.*r
And*r whatever*r things*r you*r ask*r in*r prayer,*r believing,*r you*r will*r receive.”*r
Jesus’ Authority Questioned

Now*p when He came into the temple, the chief priests and the elders of the people confronted Him as He was teaching, and said, “By what authority are You doing these things? And who gave You this authority?”

But*p Jesus answered and said to them, “I*r also*r will*r ask*r you*r one*r thing,*r which*r if*r you*r tell*r Me,*r I*r likewise*r will*r tell*r you*r by*r what*r authority*r I*r do*r these*r things:*r

The*r baptism*r of*r John—where*r was*r it*r from?*r From*r heaven*r or*r from*r men?”*r And*p they reasoned among themselves, saying, “If we say, ‘From heaven,’ He will say to us, ‘Why then did you not believe him?’
But if we say, ‘From men,’ we fear the multitude, for all count John as a prophet.”
So they answered Jesus and said, “We do not know.” And*p He said to them, “Neither*r will*r I*r tell*r you*r by*r what*r authority*r I*r do*r these*r things.*r
The Parable of the Two Sons
“But*rp what*r do*r you*r think?*r A*r man*r had*r two*r sons,*r and*r he*r came*r to*r the*r first*r and*r said,*r ‘Son,*r go,*r work*r today*r in*r my*r vineyard.’*r
He*r answered*r and*r said,*r ‘I*r will*r not,’*r but*r afterward*r he*r regretted*r it*r and*r went.*r
Then*r he*r came*r to*r the*r second*r and*r said*r likewise.*r And*r he*r answered*r and*r said,*r ‘I*r go,*ir sir,’*r but*r he*r did*r not*r go.*r

Which*r of*r the*r two*r did*r the*r will*r of*r his*ir father?”*r They*p said to Him, “The first.” Jesus*p said to them, “Assuredly,*r I*r say*r to*r you*r that*r tax*r collectors*r and*r harlots*r enter*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God*r before*r you.*r

For*r John*r came*r to*r you*r in*r the*r way*r of*r righteousness,*r and*r you*r did*r not*r believe*r him;*r but*r tax*r collectors*r and*r harlots*r believed*r him;*r and*r when*r you*r saw*r it,*ir you*r did*r not*r afterward*r relent*r and*r believe*r him.*r
The Parable of the Wicked Vinedressers

“Hear*rp another*r parable:*r There*r was*r a*r certain*r landowner*r who*r planted*r a*r vineyard*r and*r set*r a*r hedge*r around*r it,*r dug*r a*r winepress*r in*r it*r and*r built*r a*r tower.*r And*r he*r leased*r it*r to*r vinedressers*r and*r went*r into*r a*r far*r country.*r
Now*r when*r vintage-time*r drew*r near,*r he*r sent*r his*r servants*r to*r the*r vinedressers,*r that*r they*r might*r receive*r its*r fruit.*r
And*r the*r vinedressers*r took*r his*r servants,*r beat*r one,*r killed*r one,*r and*r stoned*r another.*r
Again*r he*r sent*r other*r servants,*r more*r than*r the*r first,*r and*r they*r did*r likewise*r to*r them.*r
Then*r last*r of*r all*r he*r sent*r his*r son*r to*r them,*r saying,*r ‘They*r will*r respect*r my*r son.’*r
But*r when*r the*r vinedressers*r saw*r the*r son,*r they*r said*r among*r themselves,*r ‘This*r is*r the*r heir.*r Come,*r let*r us*r kill*r him*r and*r seize*r his*r inheritance.’*r
So*r they*r took*r him*r and*r cast*r him*ir out*r of*r the*r vineyard*r and*r killed*r him.*ir
“Therefore,*rp when*r the*r owner*r of*r the*r vineyard*r comes,*r what*r will*r he*r do*r to*r those*r vinedressers?”*r
They*p said to Him, “He will destroy those wicked men miserably, and lease his*i vineyard to other vinedressers who will render to him the fruits in their seasons.”

Jesus*p said to them, “Have*r you*r never*r read*r in*r the*r Scriptures:*r ‘The*rpn stone*r which*r the*r builders*r rejected*r Has*rld become*r the*r chief*r cornerstone.*r This*rld was*r the*r Lord’s*sbr doing,*r And*rld it*r is*r marvelous*r in*r our*r eyes’?*r
“Therefore*rp I*r say*r to*r you,*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God*r will*r be*r taken*r from*r you*r and*r given*r to*r a*r nation*r bearing*r the*r fruits*r of*r it.*r
And*r whoever*r falls*r on*r this*r stone*r will*r be*r broken;*r but*r on*r whomever*r it*r falls,*r it*r will*r grind*r him*r to*r powder.”*r
Now*p when the chief priests and Pharisees heard His parables, they perceived that He was speaking of them.
But when they sought to lay hands on Him, they feared the multitudes, because they took Him for a prophet.
